a.title: Morning Announcements

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Passaic Valley's CTE Broadcasting Program Produces Pieces for Women's History Month

a.span: Passaic Valley's CTE Broadcasting Program Produces Pieces for Women's History Month

div.p: March was Women's History Month. To celebrate, students enrolled in Passaic Valley's CTE Broadcasting Program, taught by Mrs. Stephanie Roberts, produced short videos detailing famous and influential female figures in New Jersey history.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley's CTE Broadcasting Program Produces Pieces for Women's History Month

img.alt: Senior Quintuplets Receive Full Scholarship to Montclair State University

a.span: Senior Quintuplets Receive Full Scholarship to Montclair State University

div.p: MSU awarded the Povolo quintuplets with a full scholarship to their institution in a ceremony held in Campbell Hall. The gift was a surprise to four of the five siblings and their parents. Victoria Povolo had previously reached out to MSU with college tuition concerns for the family.

a.title: Go to comments for Senior Quintuplets Receive Full Scholarship to Montclair State University

img.alt: PV Choir Releases Virtual Performance Amid Remote Learning

a.span: PV Choir Releases Virtual Performance Amid Remote Learning

div.p: The PV Choir hopes to spread some well-needed cheer with their virtual performance of "I Sing Because I'm Happy". Students were accompanied by PV alumna Mike Yesenosky on piano. Choral Director Ms. Pia Vanderstreet edited the video and Mr. Yesenosky edited the audio.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Choir Releases Virtual Performance Amid Remote Learning

img.alt: [Updated with Footage from PVTV] Teen Center Presented with NJCDC Award by Former Hornet Maria Hoffman

a.span: [Updated with Footage from PVTV] Teen Center Presented with NJCDC Award by Former Hornet Maria Hoffman

div.p: The Teen Center was honored at the annual NJCDC's Friends Breakfast. Maria Hoffman was chosen to represent the Teen Center, for she was an honorable member of the program and grew to become a successful leader.

a.title: Go to comments for [Updated with Footage from PVTV] Teen Center Presented with NJCDC Award by Former Hornet Maria Hoffman

img.alt: Class of 2021 Celebrates Cotillion at The Grand

a.span: Class of 2021 Celebrates Cotillion at The Grand

div.p: On March 6th, Passaic Valley held its Junior Cotillion at The Grand in Totowa. Class advisers Mrs. Jamie Picarelli and Mr. Kevin Haimowitz planned the amazing night and Mr. Alfred Cappello attended as the photographer.

a.title: Go to comments for Class of 2021 Celebrates Cotillion at The Grand

img.alt: Passaic Valley Welcomes Jason Tiseo as New Teacher and Interim Head Baseball Coach

a.span: Passaic Valley Welcomes Jason Tiseo as New Teacher and Interim Head Baseball Coach

div.p: Passaic Valley recently welcomed Mr. Jason Tiseo to its staff as new Special Education Teacher and Interim Head Baseball Coach. Administration, students, and staff are thrilled to have his experience both in front of the classroom and on the diamond.nterim head baseball coach.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Welcomes Jason Tiseo as New Teacher and Interim Head Baseball Coach

img.alt: Timothy Shoemaker Teaches Students About the Dangers of Vaping

a.span: Timothy Shoemaker Teaches Students About the Dangers of Vaping

div.p: On February 12, freshmen, sophomore, and junior classes learned the dangers and effects of vaping. Timothy Shoemaker served as a guest lecturer informing students about the soaring rates of vaping-related illnesses and conditions plaguing high schools throughout America.

a.title: Go to comments for Timothy Shoemaker Teaches Students About the Dangers of Vaping

img.alt: PV Provides a Day of Service for Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day

a.span: PV Provides a Day of Service for Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day

div.p: For Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day this year, Passaic Valley High School held a day of service to honor the memory and influence of the civil rights leader. History and English teachers crafted original lessons focused on Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.'s life, teachings, and legacy.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Provides a Day of Service for Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day

img.alt: Girls' Show 2020 Will Stream LIVE in HD on Vimeo

a.span: Girls' Show 2020 Will Stream LIVE in HD on Vimeo

div.p: Girls' Show will premiere on February 28, 2020 at 7:00 pm. Stream Girls' Show LIVE on your favorite digital device with internet access, such as a tablet, phone, laptop, and Smart TV with a web browser using the following link: www.vimeo.com/pvrhs.

a.title: Go to comments for Girls' Show 2020 Will Stream LIVE in HD on Vimeo

img.alt: Passaic Valley Begins New Suicide Prevention Campaign as Part of Sandy Hook Promise

a.span: Passaic Valley Begins New Suicide Prevention Campaign as Part of Sandy Hook Promise

div.p: This school year, Passaic Valley is implementing a Signs of Suicide (SOS) program through the Sandy Hook Promise organization. Information is available through the links within.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Begins New Suicide Prevention Campaign as Part of Sandy Hook Promise

img.alt: Girls' Show 75th Performance Retrospective: An Interview with Director Kathleen Dellanno

a.span: Girls' Show 75th Performance Retrospective: An Interview with Director Kathleen Dellanno

div.p: February 28, 2020 will be Girls’ Show’s 75th performance. Mrs. Kathleen Dellanno, English Teacher and Director of Girls’ Show, sat down with the Valley Echo to describe her experiences as a member of Girls’ Show as a student and monitoring and directing the show as a teacher.

a.title: Go to comments for Girls' Show 75th Performance Retrospective: An Interview with Director Kathleen Dellanno

img.alt: Marching Band Takes Home First Place at State Championship

a.span: Marching Band Takes Home First Place at State Championship

div.p: Passaic Valley's Marching Band won first place in the State Championship for the first time in about 35 years on November 3rd. Passaic Valley scored higher than seven other schools in the Group I A division of the competition with a score of 87.665.

a.title: Go to comments for Marching Band Takes Home First Place at State Championship

img.alt: Mr. Anthony Ottino Retires After 14 Years

a.span: Mr. Anthony Ottino Retires After 14 Years

div.p: Mr. Anthony Ottino retired on October 1st, 2019 after 14 years at Passaic Valley. Mr. Ottino worked for IBM for 25 years and at another school district prior to his time as a Hornet. Mr. Ottino says he had a wonderful experience here and will miss his colleagues and the camaraderie he built with them.

a.title: Go to comments for Mr. Anthony Ottino Retires After 14 Years

img.alt: PVEF Continues Fundraising for New Media Center

a.span: PVEF Continues Fundraising for New Media Center

div.p: Since September 2018, the Passaic Valley Education Foundation has spearheaded an ongoing fundraiser to renovate the school library to upgrade the center's technology and update its aesthetic.

a.title: Go to comments for PVEF Continues Fundraising for New Media Center

img.alt: Science Teacher Mrs. Leidig Becomes School Librarian

a.span: Science Teacher Mrs. Leidig Becomes School Librarian

div.p: Earlier this November, former Science teacher Mrs. Daria Leidig took over the role of School Librarian. She looks forward to working with both students and staff members to supplement curriculums and enhance learning experiences.

a.title: Go to comments for Science Teacher Mrs. Leidig Becomes School Librarian

img.alt: Information Session for Parents and Students of Class of 2024 Scheduled for January 8th

a.span: Information Session for Parents and Students of Class of 2024 Scheduled for January 8th

div.p: PV invites parents/guardians and students of the Class of 2024 to this important information session on Wednesday, January 8, 2020. Attendees will receive their copy of the 2020-2021 Program of Studies Course Guide and will get a head start learning about Passaic Valley's unique learning opportunities.

a.title: Go to comments for Information Session for Parents and Students of Class of 2024 Scheduled for January 8th

img.alt: Superintendent's Message for the New Year

a.span: Superintendent's Message for the New Year

div.p: Superintendent Dr. JoAnn Cardillo shares an encouraging message for PV students and community as they return from winter break to embark on a new year in a new decade.

a.title: Go to comments for Superintendent's Message for the New Year

img.alt: PV Education Foundation Raises Money Towards Library Renovation, One Book At A Time

a.span: PV Education Foundation Raises Money Towards Library Renovation, One Book At A Time

div.p: The PVEF hosted its first book fair at the Woodland Park Barnes and Noble, with earnings contributing to the renovation of the library. From December 7-11, students and staff were able to support the cause both in-store and online by purchasing items using a specific bookfair ID code.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Education Foundation Raises Money Towards Library Renovation, One Book At A Time

img.alt: Ms. Agosta Retires After 38 Years as Special Education Teacher

a.span: Ms. Agosta Retires After 38 Years as Special Education Teacher

div.p: Ms. Jenai Agosta has retired as Special Education Teacher after 38 years. Displaying an incredible level of dedication for the community, Ms. Agosta spent the entirety of her career at Passaic Valley. She leaves behind a legacy of rigor and care in the students she taught and the staff she advised.

a.title: Go to comments for Ms. Agosta Retires After 38 Years as Special Education Teacher

img.alt: Passaic Valley Teachers Seek New Robotics Opportunities at PCCC

a.span: Passaic Valley Teachers Seek New Robotics Opportunities at PCCC

div.p: Members of the Passaic Valley staff, Mr. Michael Carlucci, Ms. Arianna Robeson, and Mr. William Phillian visited Passaic County Community College to learn more about robotics teams and competitions. The Science Department hopes to use the information to form a robotics team at Passaic Valley.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Teachers Seek New Robotics Opportunities at PCCC

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Hornet Helping Hands Expands to Beatrice Gilmore in Third Year

a.span: Hornet Helping Hands Expands to Beatrice Gilmore in Third Year

div.p: Since 2016, senior have been placed as interns at Little Falls School No. 2 to explore a career in early childhood education, an opportunity offered through the Hornet Helping Hands Program. This year, the program has expanded, sending interns to Beatrice Gilmore in Woodland Park as well.

a.title: Go to comments for Hornet Helping Hands Expands to Beatrice Gilmore in Third Year

img.alt: Dr. Iobst Awarded New Jersey Governor's Teacher of the Year

a.span: Dr. Iobst Awarded New Jersey Governor's Teacher of the Year

div.p: Dr. Susanne Iobst was awarded the New Jersey Governor's Teacher/Educational Professional of the Year award after being nominated by her colleagues. The annual award is voted on by a faculty and administrative committee.

a.title: Go to comments for Dr. Iobst Awarded New Jersey Governor's Teacher of the Year

img.alt: Passaic Valley Makes 10th Annual District Honor Roll

a.span: Passaic Valley Makes 10th Annual District Honor Roll

div.p: Recently, Passaic Valley was recognized by College Board for their students' high performance on the Advanced Placement (AP) exams. Passaic Valley is among just 21 high schools in New Jersey and 800 in America and Canada to make the AP District Honor Roll and receive this acknowledgement.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Makes 10th Annual District Honor Roll

img.alt: PRESS RELEASE: Passaic Valley Regional High School Announces Course Offerings and Academic Partnerships for 2020-21 School Year

a.span: PRESS RELEASE: Passaic Valley Regional High School Announces Course Offerings and Academic Partnerships for 2020-21 School Year

div.p: PV announced its new course offerings and expanded partnerships for the 2020-2021 school year. The Program of Studies was debuted at PV during an evening event to welcome the incoming class of 2024.

a.title: Go to comments for PRESS RELEASE: Passaic Valley Regional High School Announces Course Offerings and Academic Partnerships for 2020-21 School Year

img.alt: Passaic Valley Switches Back to Midterms and Finals After 5 Years of QBAs

a.span: Passaic Valley Switches Back to Midterms and Finals After 5 Years of QBAs

div.p: After five years, midterms and finals have replaced the QBAs as the method of assessing student progress throughout the year. From January 27-30, students took their midterms following a revised early dismissal schedule, which featured two exam periods per day.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Switches Back to Midterms and Finals After 5 Years of QBAs

img.alt: Annual Balloon Car Competition Introduces More Innovative Designs

a.span: Annual Balloon Car Competition Introduces More Innovative Designs

div.p: On Wednesday, January 15th, 2020, Physics and Physics Honors classes held their annual balloon car design competition. Students were tasked with constructing a toy car powered by a balloon. They had the freedom to explore several designs and materials, ranging from water bottle caps to CDs.

a.title: Go to comments for Annual Balloon Car Competition Introduces More Innovative Designs

img.alt: Local Business Professionals Share Their Expertise with Financial Literacy Students

a.span: Local Business Professionals Share Their Expertise with Financial Literacy Students

div.p: Mrs. Ennely Thornton's Financial Literacy Class welcomed several of very special guests throughout the 2019-2020 school year. Guest lecturers reinforced the concepts learned in class and exposed students to the perspective of professionals in the field of financial planning.

a.title: Go to comments for Local Business Professionals Share Their Expertise with Financial Literacy Students

img.alt: Ms. Miskovich Collaborates with Writing Lab to Aid Students During the Revision Process

a.span: Ms. Miskovich Collaborates with Writing Lab to Aid Students During the Revision Process

div.p: English Teacher Ms. Michele Miskovich took an innovative approach to essay revising. Instead of having her students visit the writing lab for critiques, she decided to have the writing lab come to them.

a.title: Go to comments for Ms. Miskovich Collaborates with Writing Lab to Aid Students During the Revision Process

img.alt: At Passaic Valley, Educators are Constant Learners

a.span: At Passaic Valley, Educators are Constant Learners

div.p: Passaic Valley embodies the belief that effective educators are also constant learners. Since the beginning of the school year, teachers have been active in programs and workshops to improve their instructional skills and pedagogy.

a.title: Go to comments for At Passaic Valley, Educators are Constant Learners

img.alt: PV Volunteer Math Peer Tutoring Program Continues to Support Middle Schoolers

a.span: PV Volunteer Math Peer Tutoring Program Continues to Support Middle Schoolers

div.p: Roughly 6 years ago, math teacher Mr. Salvatore Sileo, developed the PV Volunteer Math Peer Tutoring Program for students in sending districts. The program continues to improve student achievement in mathematics, increasing test scores and preparedness for the high school level.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Volunteer Math Peer Tutoring Program Continues to Support Middle Schoolers

img.alt: Dr. Pytal Speaks About Psychology with Human Behavior

a.span: Dr. Pytal Speaks About Psychology with Human Behavior

div.p: On October 4, PV alum Dr. Anastasia Pytal met with and talked to Mr. Jeffrey Francisco's Human Behavior classes. Her guest lecture gave students the opportunity to learn more about how different disorders correlate to the brain and provided an in-depth understanding of how the brain works.

a.title: Go to comments for Dr. Pytal Speaks About Psychology with Human Behavior

img.alt: Mr. Michael O'Brien Begins Career as New Social Studies Teacher

a.span: Mr. Michael O'Brien Begins Career as New Social Studies Teacher

div.p: Mr. Michael O' Brien was hired as a new Social Studies/Special Education teacher for the 2019-2020 school year. He teaches US History in both co-teaching and traditional capacities.

a.title: Go to comments for Mr. Michael O'Brien Begins Career as New Social Studies Teacher

img.alt: New Gender Studies Elective Incorporates Modern and Historical Feminism into Curriculum

a.span: New Gender Studies Elective Incorporates Modern and Historical Feminism into Curriculum

div.p: The English Department developed a new elective course for students in grades 11 and 12 called Gender Studies. The half-year course focuses on gender issues in the current world, while also overviewing feminism throughout history.

a.title: Go to comments for New Gender Studies Elective Incorporates Modern and Historical Feminism into Curriculum

img.alt: Broadcasting Program Approved as Official Career and Technical Education Program of Study

a.span: Broadcasting Program Approved as Official Career and Technical Education Program of Study

div.p: Earlier this year, Passaic Valley's Broadcasting Program received approval as an official Career and Technical Education (CTE) Program of Study as defined by the New Jersey Department of Education and federal guidelines.

a.title: Go to comments for Broadcasting Program Approved as Official Career and Technical Education Program of Study

img.alt: Raima Islam '21 with her project; photo credit: Raisa Islam '19

a.span: Raima Islam ‘21 Places First at 2019 MARM Chemagination Competition

div.p: On Saturday June 1st, sophomore Raima Islam competed in the 2019 MARM Chemagination Competition held at the University of Maryland, Baltimore County. Her project, “Bridging the Gap—Combating Retinal Detachment” placed first in the Health/Medicine category.

a.title: Go to comments for Raima Islam ‘21 Places First at 2019 MARM Chemagination Competition

img.alt: Brian Katat '20 with Ms. Jennifer Shue and Mr. Bill Pantale; photo credit: Raima Islam '21

a.span: Junior Brian Katat Accepted into NJ Governor's School in the Sciences

div.p: On April 5th, Brian Katat ’20 was notified that he had been accepted into the New Jersey Governor’s School in the Sciences. New Jersey Governor’s School is a tuition-free summer program created in 1983 for students interested in entering STEM careers in the future.

a.title: Go to comments for Junior Brian Katat Accepted into NJ Governor's School in the Sciences

img.alt: Dr. Martin Carroll Guest Teaches Python Programming Course

a.span: Dr. Martin Carroll Guest Teaches Python Programming Course

div.p: From March 22nd to the 26th, Passaic Valley’s STEM classes were exposed to Python, a commonly used professional programming language. Dr. Martin Carroll, of Nokia Bell Labs, served as a guest professor and educated students on STEM research along with additional exposure to the field of technology.

a.title: Go to comments for Dr. Martin Carroll Guest Teaches Python Programming Course

img.alt: Anatomy and Physiology Class Visits WPU; photo credit: Grace Rose '19

a.span: Field Trip to William Paterson University Enhances Anatomy Honors Lesson

div.p: Anatomy and Physiology Honors students visited William Paterson University for a tour of Dr. Kelley Healey's molecular biology research lab and Dr. Sonya Bierbower's neuroscience research lab on Friday March 29th.

a.title: Go to comments for Field Trip to William Paterson University Enhances Anatomy Honors Lesson

img.alt: Physics Brings Music to Class with Instrument Projects

a.span: Physics Brings Music to Class with Instrument Projects

div.p: In March, Mrs. Elena Shtraks’ and Mr. Kevin Haimowitz’ physics classes undertook the Music Instrument Project, where each student discussed the relationship between their chosen instrument and physics, followed by a short musical performance.

a.title: Go to comments for Physics Brings Music to Class with Instrument Projects

img.alt: U.S. Navy Member Presents to the Class; Property of Mr. William Phillian

a.span: Principles of Engineering Welcomes Guest Speakers from U.S. Navy

div.p: On March 7th, the 6th period Principles of Engineering Honors class and Physics Club welcomed guest speakers Mikel Hamlin and Francis Waligur to talk about nuclear engineering in the U.S. Navy.

a.title: Go to comments for Principles of Engineering Welcomes Guest Speakers from U.S. Navy

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: Head Football Coach Chet Parlavecchio Leaves Treasured Legacy After Retiring From the Sport

a.span: Head Football Coach Chet Parlavecchio Leaves Treasured Legacy After Retiring From the Sport

div.p: Passaic Valley’s Head Football Coach Mr. Chet Parlavecchio has announced his retirement from the sport. As head coach for the Hornets for a total of 10 years, Coach Parlavecchio is recognized for his dedication to Passaic Valley students and his leadership of the program.

a.title: Go to comments for Head Football Coach Chet Parlavecchio Leaves Treasured Legacy After Retiring From the Sport

img.alt: Girls Volleyball Looks Back on Tremendous Season

a.span: Girls Volleyball Looks Back on Tremendous Season

div.p: As the 2019 fall season draws to a close, we recognize the Girls' Varsity Volleyball Team for their exceptional season. The Hornets finished 17-7, made it to the county final, and qualified for the state tournament for the first time in years.

a.title: Go to comments for Girls Volleyball Looks Back on Tremendous Season

img.alt: Girls' Soccer Shows Their Support with Annual Breast Cancer Awareness Game

a.span: Girls' Soccer Shows Their Support with Annual Breast Cancer Awareness Game

div.p: Every October our Hornet sports teams hold Breast Cancer Awareness games to honor those impacted by the disease. Girls' Soccer hosted their annual game against Cedar Grove on October 5th to emphasize that, in October, our teams play for an additional goal.

a.title: Go to comments for Girls' Soccer Shows Their Support with Annual Breast Cancer Awareness Game

img.alt: PV Soccer; property of Mr. Carcich

a.span: PV Soccer Secure Top Spot in County Tournament

div.p: The boys' Varsity Soccer team has had an astonishing run this season, accomplishing a 9-3-1 record and becoming the Big North Independence Division Champions. Taking the top seed in the County Tournament, the team will face Passaic High School this weekend at home.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Soccer Secure Top Spot in County Tournament

img.alt: New Social Studies Teacher Stephen Smith Becomes New Freshman Football Coach

a.span: New Social Studies Teacher Stephen Smith Becomes New Freshman Football Coach

div.p: It has been a very exciting start to the school year for Mr. Stephen Smith. The new history teacher was also named head coach for freshman football. The freshman team has grown immensely as a result of Smith’s experience as a football player and all the work he has put into this team.

a.title: Go to comments for New Social Studies Teacher Stephen Smith Becomes New Freshman Football Coach

img.alt: Three Hornets Display Talent in Annual All-Star Games

a.span: Three Hornets Display Talent in Annual All-Star Games

div.p: Three senior Hornet athletes participated in local All-Star Games this spring. Antwan Rodgers, Matthew Jaeger, and Steven Nitch contributed significantly to their respective teams and represented the prestige of Passaic Valley Sports.

a.title: Go to comments for Three Hornets Display Talent in Annual All-Star Games

img.alt: Carlos Morales '17; photo credits: Mr. Mazzo

a.span: Carlos Morales Swings His Way into Senior Season

div.p: Spring sports are now in session and, for some athletes, it will be their last season in high school. For one senior baseball player, Carlos Morales '17, his final season is also his fourth consecutive year on the varsity squad, a rare and prestigious achievement.

a.title: Go to comments for Carlos Morales Swings His Way into Senior Season

img.alt: Passaic Valley Sends Off Twelve Future College Athletes on Athletic Signing Day

a.span: Passaic Valley Sends Off Twelve Future College Athletes on Athletic Signing Day

div.p: On June 7th, the 3rd annual Athletic Signing Day was held for twelve student athletes on their way to collegiate athletics. The presentation was held during 2nd period in the Senior Cafe, in which the students were joined by their families to rejoice in their accomplishments.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Sends Off Twelve Future College Athletes on Athletic Signing Day

img.alt: Photo from PV Sports; photo courtesy of Mr. Joe Benvenuti

a.span: Summer 2019 Sports Camps Open for Registration

div.p: Each year, PV offers its Summer Sports Camps for local students from grades 3-8. The camps give students the opportunity to try out a sport and reinforce their skills and abilities.

a.title: Go to comments for Summer 2019 Sports Camps Open for Registration

img.alt: Bennett Scores 200th Goal with Team; photo credit: Ms. Lori Demsey

a.span: Catherine Bennett ‘19 Makes History with 200th Career Goal

div.p: On Wednesday, May 8, Catherine Bennett ‘19 made PV history with her 200th career goal. In an intense game against Clifton, the girls’ lacrosse star and senior captain became the first Hornet to achieve this remarkable accomplishment.

a.title: Go to comments for Catherine Bennett ‘19 Makes History with 200th Career Goal

img.alt: Colby Sellitto '21 at the NJSIAA headquarters; photo courtesy of Mr. Joseph Benvenuti

a.span: Accomplished Wrestler Colby Sellitto '21 Represents PV as an NJSIAA Ambassador

div.p: Colby Sellitto '21 has already managed to make a name for himself in the athletic and academic world. He has an impressive wrestling record and was chosen to be a student ambassador for the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association, all while maintaining his impressive 4.65 GPA.

a.title: Go to comments for Accomplished Wrestler Colby Sellitto '21 Represents PV as an NJSIAA Ambassador

img.alt: As the Indoor Track and Field season comes to a conclusion, it has given many of PV’s runners a cha

div.p: This Indoor Track season was particularly memorable for the Freshmen Boys 4x800 Relay Team. They displayed their athleticism, heart, and considerable potential at each meet. At one point in the season, they came in 1st for three consecutive meets.

a.title: Go to comments for Frosh Boys 4x800 Team Wins Three-Peat

img.alt: Taylor Hill '21 and Colby Sellitto '21; photo courtesy of @PVHS_SPORTS on Twitter

a.span: Recognizing Taylor Hill ‘21 for Achieving Goals in Sports and Academics

div.p: PV is a melting pot of exceptional students, one of which is Taylor Hill ‘21. Only a sophomore, Hill has already proven herself to be one of the most athletic, intelligent, and kind students at PV.

a.title: Go to comments for Recognizing Taylor Hill ‘21 for Achieving Goals in Sports and Academics

img.alt: Hornets Raise Breast Cancer Awareness During October

a.span: Hornets Raise Breast Cancer Awareness During October

div.p: October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Several sports teams acknowledged the suffering of those dear to players and coaches. These special games and events show the character of Passaic Valley’s student athletes and their dedication to find a cure.

a.title: Go to comments for Hornets Raise Breast Cancer Awareness During October

img.alt: Hornets Soar with Spirit for Homecoming '18

a.span: Hornets Soar with Spirit for Homecoming '18

div.p: For this year’s Homecoming, students and staff felt it was time to deliver something more unique and engaging. The arrangements for this year’s game, and the pep rally which preceded it, not only exceeded the community’s high expectations, but left its members with an incredible experience.

a.title: Go to comments for Hornets Soar with Spirit for Homecoming '18

img.alt: Baseball Continues Hard Work Through Summer League

a.span: Baseball Continues Hard Work Through Summer League

div.p: Varsity Baseball participated in the High School Developmental League (HSDL), held during summer vacation months. PV won the regular season and represented Passaic and Bergen Counties in the state tournament, where they eventually lost to Montville.

a.title: Go to comments for Baseball Continues Hard Work Through Summer League

img.alt: Inside the World of Leaps and Layouts: Gymnastics Flies in 2018

a.span: Inside the World of Leaps and Layouts: Gymnastics Flies in 2018

div.p: Varsity Gymnastics has proven its potential through the great accomplishments and placings achieved so far this season, winning more meets in 2018 than all wins combined in the past 7 years. The team has already captured four wins, their highest score being an outstanding 99.75 out of 120 possible points.

a.title: Go to comments for Inside the World of Leaps and Layouts: Gymnastics Flies in 2018

img.alt: New Student Section, The Swarm, Allows Hornets to Display PV Pride

a.span: New Student Section, The Swarm, Allows Hornets to Display PV Pride

div.p: Students of Passaic Valley have been rallying up this year with reinvigorated school spirit and pep due to the new student section, The Swarm. Thanks to creator Sophia Ayoub '19 and wide-spread support from the community, The Swarm has flourished during these first couple of weeks of school.

a.title: Go to comments for New Student Section, The Swarm, Allows Hornets to Display PV Pride

img.alt: Baseball Matches Softball's County Success

div.p: The Hornets had an unbelievable run in the county tournament this year. Given a first round bye, the Hornets made it all the way to the County Tournament Championship, where they fell to DePaul.

a.title: Go to comments for Baseball Matches Softball's County Success

img.alt: Lady Hornets Get Passaic County Buzzing in Softball Tournament

a.span: Lady Hornets Get Passaic County Buzzing in Softball Tournament

div.p: The Varsity Softball Team had a great regular season (11-5), earning a two-round bye going into Counties. In an impressive run, the Lady Hornets reached the championship game where they lost a heartbreaker to DePaul.

a.title: Go to comments for Lady Hornets Get Passaic County Buzzing in Softball Tournament

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

img.alt: NAHS Collects 20 Grocery Bags Worth of Goods During Soup-er Bowl Food Drive

a.span: NAHS Collects 20 Grocery Bags Worth of Goods During Soup-er Bowl Food Drive

div.p: Throughout the month of January, the National Art Honor Society collected 20 grocery bags worth of canned goods, which were then donated to the Human Needs Food Pantry, in their eighth annual Soup-er Bowl Canned Food Drive.

a.title: Go to comments for NAHS Collects 20 Grocery Bags Worth of Goods During Soup-er Bowl Food Drive

img.alt: Nine Students Perform at TCNJ Honors Festival for First Time

a.span: Nine Students Perform at TCNJ Honors Festival for First Time

div.p: March is Music in Our Schools Month (MIOSM). To commemorate MIOSM, the Valley Echo is highlighting Passaic Valley's involvement in the The College of New Jersey (TCNJ) Honors Festival for the first time.

a.title: Go to comments for Nine Students Perform at TCNJ Honors Festival for First Time

img.alt: PV Takes Home Best Play and Best Musical at STANJ 2020

a.span: PV Takes Home Best Play and Best Musical at STANJ 2020

div.p: On January 11, 2020, students and teachers participated in the Speech and STANJ competition at Montclair State University. Throughout the night, Passaic Valley took home Best Play and Best Musical awards.

a.title: Go to comments for PV Takes Home Best Play and Best Musical at STANJ 2020

img.alt: Students Display Unique Talents at Annual Variety Show

a.span: Students Display Unique Talents at Annual Variety Show

div.p: On December 17, 2019, the annual Variety Show took place in the Schneider Auditorium at Passaic Valley. Presented by the Drama Club, the Variety Show gives students who may not be a part of the Theater or Music program a chance to shine on the PV stage.

a.title: Go to comments for Students Display Unique Talents at Annual Variety Show

img.alt: Band, Choir, and Hornet Harmonics Usher in the Holidays with a Beautiful Performance

a.span: Band, Choir, and Hornet Harmonics Usher in the Holidays with a Beautiful Performance

div.p: On Thursday, December 19, the Passaic Valley Band, Choir and Hornet Harmonics hosted their annual Winter Concert to celebrate the upcoming holidays and winter season. Both gave strong performances for students, staff and community members in the Schneider Auditorium.

a.title: Go to comments for Band, Choir, and Hornet Harmonics Usher in the Holidays with a Beautiful Performance

img.alt: Holiday Play to Feature Original Script by Mia Preziosi and Mark Huggins

a.span: Holiday Play to Feature Original Script by Mia Preziosi and Mark Huggins

div.p: Passaic Valley's Theater Department announced the annual winter holiday production, Charlie Brown's Christmas Spectacular. The musical marks the first time an original script, written by Mia Preziosi '20 and Mark Huggins '20, is being produced for the stage.

a.title: Go to comments for Holiday Play to Feature Original Script by Mia Preziosi and Mark Huggins

img.alt: Ms. Vanderstreet Takes Helm of Lend Me a Tenor in Her Directorial Debut

a.span: Ms. Vanderstreet Takes Helm of Lend Me a Tenor in Her Directorial Debut

div.p: Passaic Valley Theater is wrapping up its rehearsals for their annual Fall Show Lend Me A Tenor, on stage October 24th, 25th, and 26th. The comedy is Director Ms. Pia Vanderstreet's first play in that role.

a.title: Go to comments for Ms. Vanderstreet Takes Helm of Lend Me a Tenor in Her Directorial Debut

img.alt: Summer Theater Impresses with Zombie Prom and Shrek Jr

a.span: Summer Theater Impresses with Zombie Prom and Shrek Jr

div.p: Passaic Valley Summer Theater put on two fantastic plays this summer: Zombie Prom and Shrek Jr. Maggie and Mike Lavagno directed the production of Zombie Prom, with Ms. Pia Vanderstreet as Musical Director. Mr. Michael DeLuccia and directed Shrek Jr.

a.title: Go to comments for Summer Theater Impresses with Zombie Prom and Shrek Jr

img.alt: Passaic Valley Students Participate in Stevens Math Olympiad

a.span: Passaic Valley Students Participate in Stevens Math Olympiad

div.p: On May 18, Stevens Institute of Technology hosted its annual Stevens Math Olympiad. This was the first year PV students participated in the event. The participants included Elizabeth Dubov ‘21, Betul Koc ‘21, and Lia Trewhella ‘22 accompanied by Mrs. Thornton, Mrs. Kurtishi, and Mrs. Robeson.

a.title: Go to comments for Passaic Valley Students Participate in Stevens Math Olympiad

img.alt: Environmental Club Hosts Tesla Presentation

div.p: On Wednesday, May 22, the Environmental Club, in collaboration with the Engineering Club, hosted a representative from Tesla to discuss the company and their role in making environmentally efficient vehicles.

a.title: Go to comments for Environmental Club Hosts Tesla Presentation

img.alt: Memorial Day Parade Performance; photo credit: Mr. DeLuccia

a.span: Marching Band and Color Guard Honor Veterans Throughout Memorial Day Weekend

div.p: The Marching Band performed at Wilmore Road Park to kick off Memorial Day Weekend. The following day, the band, joined by the Color Guard, honored and remembered US veterans in the annual Memorial Day Parade, hosted by The American Legion Singac Post 108 & The Township of Little Falls.

a.title: Go to comments for Marching Band and Color Guard Honor Veterans Throughout Memorial Day Weekend

img.alt: Gelotti's Contest Tiles; property of Ms. Carolyn Ingraham

a.span: Students Show Off Artistic Talent & Hornet Pride in Gelotti's Ceiling Tile Contest

div.p: Students with a passion for art were recently allowed to show off their talents and PV pride thanks to Gelotti's Ceiling Tile Contest. The tiles will be displayed in the newly renovated Gelotti's in Paterson.

a.title: Go to comments for Students Show Off Artistic Talent & Hornet Pride in Gelotti's Ceiling Tile Contest

img.alt: Addams Family the Musical Logo

a.span: Spring Musical 2019: Addams Family Amazes and Amuses

div.p: The Drama Club and Theater Department debuted the annual spring musical, Addams Family: The Musical, in Schneider Auditorium on May 9th, 10th, and 11th. The Spring Musical was very successful and the most well-attended musical at PV in the last four years.

a.title: Go to comments for Spring Musical 2019: Addams Family Amazes and Amuses

img.alt: The flyer for Hey Jude 2019; Photo Credit: Isabella Nicosia

a.span: Annual Hey Jude Concert Promises to Wow Audiences

div.p: This year’s eleventh annual Hey Jude concert is set to take place Friday, May 31st. Audiences can look forward to seeing bands made up of both students and teachers coming together to raise money for Saint Jude’s research hospital.

a.title: Go to comments for Annual Hey Jude Concert Promises to Wow Audiences

img.alt: Awarded Performers - Marc Garcia '19 and Gabriella Volonnino '19; photo credit: Ms. Jennifer Shue

a.span: Garcia '19 and Volonnino '19 Among Award Recipients at Annual Bucks County Competition

div.p: On April 4, the Theater Department traveled to New Hope, Pennsylvania for their annual Bucks County Playhouse field trip. This year, PV brought home 3 awards - Best Vocal Performance: Gabriella Volonnino ‘19, Best Comedic Actor: Marc Garcia ‘19, and Best Musical Ensemble.

a.title: Go to comments for Garcia '19 and Volonnino '19 Among Award Recipients at Annual Bucks County Competition

img.alt: A photo of the Addams Family Flyer; Photo Credit: @pvhs.theater (via instagram)

a.span: Highly Anticipated Addams Family Now on Stage

div.p: The Addams Family hits Schneider Auditorium on Thursday May 9th, and additional showtimes include Friday May 10th, and Saturday May 11th. Performances begin at 7pm each night. The audience can look forward to an amusingly peculiar show about your not-so-average family.

a.title: Go to comments for Highly Anticipated Addams Family Now on Stage

img.alt: Spring Fling Dancing; photo credit: Steven Capone

a.span: PV/Bergen Hosts First Annual Spring Fling Dance

div.p: On Thursday, April 18th, the PV/Bergen ABA Program hosted its first annual Spring Fling. Students from Banyan and Pequannock High School joined PV’s own in the Senior Café for an unforgettable night of music and dancing.

a.title: Go to comments for PV/Bergen Hosts First Annual Spring Fling Dance

img.alt: Fourth Annual Autism Walk Raises Proceeds Toward PV/Bergen ABA Program

a.span: Fourth Annual Autism Walk Raises Proceeds Toward PV/Bergen ABA Program

div.p: On Sunday April 14th, PV held its fourth annual Autism Walk at the track. Around six hundred students, staff, friends, and family members came to support the PV/Bergen ABA Program and over nine thousand dollars were donated.

a.title: Go to comments for Fourth Annual Autism Walk Raises Proceeds Toward PV/Bergen ABA Program

img.alt: Annual Poetry Contest Accepting Submissions Until April 12

a.span: Annual Poetry Contest Accepting Submissions Until April 12

div.p: The Literary Club's annual Poetry Contest, which has been a tradition here for many years, is an event that many students look forward to as a way to express their emotions and showcase their inner Shakespeare. The Literary Club is currently accepting submissions for the contest until April 12th.

a.title: Go to comments for Annual Poetry Contest Accepting Submissions Until April 12

img.alt: Participating sophomores at Kean University; photo courtesy of @pvhssuper on Instagram

a.span: Sophomores Participate in National History Day Competition at Kean University

div.p: On March 9th, sophomores Brianna Trewhella, Victoria Corrado, Carolyn Rosenberg, and Lilli Harrington competed in the National History Day competition, held at Kean University.

a.title: Go to comments for Sophomores Participate in National History Day Competition at Kean University
